Responsibilities: Improved the functionality of an interactive accessibility map
Optimized zoom-in and sidebar navigation features
Designed and implemented a backend system using Python for real-time emotion analysis and trend prediction with AI models (LSTM/Transformers)
Integrated encryption protocols and adaptive learning for user privacy and data security
Enhanced the LightGBM algorithm with custom loss functions and feature engineering
Developed preprocessing methods for a dataset of 60,000 rows
Designed and fine-tuned an ensemble forecasting system combining SARIMA, LightGBM, and Transformers
Researched and planned backend architecture for a Dynamic Course Recommender app
Investigated machine learning libraries for personalized course recommendation algorithms
Evaluated web scraping tools and NLP libraries for gathering and analyzing course information
Planned and designed an interface using vanilla JavaScript
Implemented features and interactions to elevate user experience
Led a team of 200 in a startup initiative during the second wave of COVID-19 in India
Coordinated efforts to secure oxygen cylinders and essential supplies

Projects.Name: DocuQuery
Details: Developed a document-based QA tool using semantic search and GPT-3.5
Processed PDFs into context windows using SentenceTransformers
Delivered real-time answers through a local Streamlit UI

Projects.Name: Resumagic
Details: Built a client-side AI tool using Gemini API and PDF.js to convert resumes into portfolio websites
Integrated AWS Lambda for Gemini API interactions and implemented usage throttling
Deployed the frontend via Amazon S3 and CloudFront

Projects.Name: Findr by OpuLnt
Details: Developed a lost-and-found app for ASU students, focusing on backend development
Designed secure systems for item listings and direct messaging

Projects.Name: EventFinder
Details: Developed an iOS app for event searching based on pincode and distance
Integrated with Ticketmaster Discovery API and CoreLocation
Used SwiftUI, CoreData, and MVVM architecture

Projects.Name: ThriveSpace
Details: Developed a full-stack web app for mental well-being
Designed secure systems for data privacy

Projects.Name: Hacks for Humanity
Details: Implemented an OTP password generator login system for a website
Orchestrated back-end development for the full-stack project
Constructed sections of the database and applied the 6-Sigma (DMAIC) concept

questions.question: Imagine you are working on the WheelEasy map again and a critical bug emerges during peak usage, preventing users from accessing accessibility information.  How do you prioritize your next steps?
options: Immediately revert to the previous stable version and then investigate the bug.
Focus on identifying the root cause of the bug before taking any action.
Communicate the issue to users, offering a temporary workaround while working on a fix.
Begin working on a hotfix while simultaneously investigating the root cause and communicating with affected users.

questions.question: During your time at PwC, you worked with a large dataset.  Reflecting on that experience, what was your most valuable learning regarding data preprocessing?
options: The importance of automated data cleaning scripts for efficiency.
Understanding the data's nuances and its impact on model performance.
The value of using established preprocessing libraries to save time.
The need for meticulous documentation of each preprocessing step.

questions.question: In developing Resumagic, you used AWS Lambda.  Imagine the cost of Lambda functions unexpectedly skyrockets. What is your initial course of action?
options: Immediately reduce Lambda usage by implementing stricter rate limiting.
Investigate CloudWatch logs and metrics to understand the cause of the increased cost.
Switch to a different serverless platform to potentially lower costs.
Contact AWS support to inquire about potential billing errors or unusual activity.

questions.question: During your time leading ParmarthNGO, you had to make quick decisions under pressure. Can you describe a situation where your initial plan didn't work, and how you adapted?
options: Our initial supplier for oxygen cylinders backed out.  I immediately contacted backup suppliers and negotiated expedited delivery, even at a higher cost.
We faced transportation challenges due to lockdown restrictions.  I re-organized our logistics, leveraging local volunteers with permits for essential services.
The demand for supplies overwhelmed our initial estimates. I implemented a triage system, prioritizing critical needs and seeking additional resources from government agencies.
Communication breakdowns hindered coordination efforts. I established clear communication channels and reporting structures, ensuring real-time updates and accountability.

questions.question: Reflecting on the development of Findr by OpuLnt, what was the biggest challenge you encountered related to designing secure systems, and how did you overcome it?
options: Protecting user data during transmission. We implemented end-to-end encryption for all direct messages and item listings.
Securing the backend against unauthorized access. We implemented robust authentication and authorization mechanisms, including multi-factor authentication.
Preventing spam and fraudulent listings.  We developed a system for user verification and reporting suspicious activity, combined with automated content moderation.
Balancing security with user experience.  We streamlined the security measures to minimize friction for users while maintaining a high level of protection.
